# Solving Exponential and Log Equations

## if a^x = a^y then x = y

- 10^x = 20
	- \log{10^x} = \log{20}
	- x = \log{20}
	- x = 1.301

## if \log[a]{M} = \log[a]{N} then M=N

	- \log{5x} =  \log{2x^2}
		- 5x = 20x^2
		- 0	= 20x^2 - 5x
		- 0	= 5x(4x-1)
		- 5x	= 0
		- 4x-1	= 0
		- x cannot be equal to zero therefore x = 1/4
	- e^.08t	= 2500
		- ln(e^.08t)	= ln(2500)
		- .08t		= ln(2500)
		- t		= ln(2500)/.08
	- log[2](x)	= -3
		- 2^-3	= x
	- log[2](x+1)+log[2](x-1)	= 3
		- log[2](x+1)(x-1)	= 3
		- log[2](x^2-1)		= 3
	- 4-2e^x	= -23
		- -2e^x	= -27
		- e^x	= 13.5
		- ln(e^x)=ln(13.5)
		- x	= 2.603
